items.sentence: We didn't know what we were going to find, but we kept looking.
I knew right from the start that I wouldn't be able to do that.
Just learn to seize the opportunity, because it's always there.
You should know better than to spend all your money on clothes.
Tom had a pair of fuzzy dice hanging from his rear-view mirror.
It would've been better if Tom had stayed in Boston all summer.
I think Tom should tell Mary that he can't really speak French.
Tom says he doesn't know when Mary is planning to go to Boston.
I wonder if Tom could be persuaded to teach my children French.
Tom said he didn't think Mary had studied French for very long.
Tom said he thought Mary was planning to go to Boston with him.
The first time that I went to Australia, I didn't like it much.
Tom will be singing a couple of songs at our wedding reception.
Tom couldn't go to college because he didn't have enough money.
Tom took the flask of bourbon out of his pocket and took a sip.
When you buy something, examine it carefully before you buy it.
Tom has an alibi. He was with me at the time Mary was murdered.
If we keep spending money at this rate, we soon won't have any.
In order to buy a ticket, you'll have to wait at least an hour.
Many mistakes could've been avoided through simple experiments.
